citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A female Shiba Inu dog (Ruby, 18-70, DOB 9/12/17) was thin with an abdominal tuck. Her mucous membranes were
pale. She was nursing seven 4-week old puppies. The owner stated he had been feeding her an egg every three days
to supplement her and that she was looking better. There was no consultation with a veterinarian to establish a diagnosis
or to confirm that this was the correct treatment for this dog. Poor body condition can be the result of parasites,
inadequate nutrition, or an underlying medical condition. Ruby must be evaluated by a veterinarian within 3 days of this
inspection, to know with certainty the problem and the correct treatment. Documentation of the evaluation, recommended
treatment and delivered treatments must be available to APHIS officials.
To be corrected by 17 June 2022

Three water receptacles had green algae coating the sides and bottom of the receptacles. The water had a green tinge
to it. Several other water bowls had a brown color to them. The water may be contaminated but is obviously not potable
drinking water. Contaminated water can cause illness or be unpalatable to animals. All water receptacles must be kept
clean and sanitary and maintained.
To be corrected by: close of business this day.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A female Shiba Inu dog (Ruby, 18-70, DOB 9/12/17) was thin with an abdominal tuck.  Her mucous membranes were 
pale.  She was nursing seven 4-week old puppies.   The owner stated he had been feeding her an egg every three days 
to supplement her and that she was looking better. There was no consultation with a veterinarian to establish a diagnosis 
or to confirm that this was the correct treatment for this dog. Poor body condition can be the result of parasites, 
inadequate nutrition, or an underlying medical condition.  Ruby must be evaluated by a veterinarian within 3 days of this 
inspection, to know with certainty the problem and the correct treatment. Documentation of the evaluation, recommended 
treatment and delivered treatments must be available to APHIS officials. 
 
To be corrected by 17 June 2022 
3.10(a) 
   
Watering 
Three water receptacles had green algae coating the sides and bottom of the receptacles.   The water had a green tinge 
to it.  Several other water bowls had a brown color to them.   The water may be contaminated but is obviously not potable 
drinking water.  Contaminated water can cause illness or be unpalatable to animals. All water receptacles must be kept 
clean and sanitary and maintained.

To be corrected by:  close of business this day. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
End Section
